record.description: Air view of Jarmo (Iraq), one of the world's oldest known agricultural communities. A 1948 expedition led by Robert J. Braidwood, field director for the University of Chicago's Oriental Institute, first discovered the settlement, which has been dated to 4750 B.C.E based on radiocarbon dating of charcoal from fire pits.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Separate caption, also cites it as "Oriental Institute Photo." Pr stamps.
